citation.article-title: Mesorhizobium alhagi sp. nov., isolated from wild Alhagi sparsifolia in north-western China
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Mesorhizobium alhagi sp. nov.
Mesorhizobium alhagi (al.ha′gi. N.L. gen. n. alhagi of Alhagi, a genus of leguminous plants, referring to the host from which the type strain was isolated).
Gram-negative, non-spore-forming rods, aerobic, motile, 0.5–0.7 μm wide by 1.3–1.5 μm long (Supplementary Fig. S2).

Colonies on YMA (10.0 g mannitol, 3.0 g yeast extract, 0.25 g K2HPO4, 0.2 g MgSO4 . 7H2O, 0.1 g NaCl, 20 g agar, 1000 ml distilled water; pH 6.8–7.0) are white, opaque, circular and convex with diameter of 1–2 mm within 7 days at 28 °C.
Generation time ranges from 4.8 to 6.6 h in TY broth (5.0 g tryptone, 3.0 g yeast extract, 0.7 g CaCl2 . 2H2O, 1000 ml distilled water; pH 6.8–7.0).
Produces acid on YMA and utilizes sodium citrate, d-sorbitol, rhamnose, l-arabinose, d-xylose and galactose as sole carbon source.
Does not utilize sodium oxalate, glycogen or sodium hippurate as sole carbon source, or utilize dl-histidine as sole nitrogen source.
Growth occurs on YMA at pH 10.0, 1 % NaCl and with 0.1 % neutral red and 0.1 % NaNO2.
Sensitive to streptomycin, gentamicin sulfate, amikacin sulfate (50 μg ml−1) and 5 μg ampicillin ml−1.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 59.5–63.3 mol%.
The type strain, CCNWXJ12-2T (=ACCC 15461T=HAMBI 3019T), was isolated from a root nodule of Alhagi sparsifolia in Alaer, Xinjiang, China.
